Kuna chit’u CHIMWENGA tu uhenzwacho uchimanye dzulu ya jisi chirusi cha k’orona
eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

dug: Cho chirusi chinagot’a chikala madenwa gaga
Fyalaluka k’anda. Mita 2 zinaidima kukwika salama kulaa kwa madenwa mabomu.
eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.

dug: Kwa vivyo uchona mut’u lwazu-lwazu unakohola/ unach’emula/ni mukongo unaidima kutsagula ku:
eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

dug: Aphe vitambaa vya kufunga p’ula na mulomo/masiki. Anaidima kukoholera hebu akach’emulira na kurinda chila mut’u ariye phephi
eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby

dug: Phanjine hata ts’i mukongo, ela mwenye yunadzirinda tu.
eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

dug: At’u odziambukizwa anaidima kuts’aonyesa dalili, ela acheri anaambukiza
eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

dug: Na kwa jumula, ni azo idzo kudzitenga na virundu, kwa kukala k’umanya ni ani ariye ni mukongo.
eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

dug: Mikowa kahi za gari ya moshi
Vidude vya kufyeha vya mashine ya kupandira na kutsererera gorofani

eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

dug: Hata vivyo, ukati unjine mahe ga mut’u mukongo ganaidima kugwerera vit’u vinjine…
eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

dug: Na uchigwira zani chit’u chochosi kati ya vivi, chidzako ukumbe usoo,
eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

dug: na njira ya tende ya kuvyusa ni kuvyoga na sabuni, jik’i, hebu uchi.
eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

dug: Virusi vinaidima kukala kwa masaa machache dzulu ya vit’u
eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

dug: Ndo mana ni vidzo piya kutuwa yiyi
eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here

dug: Uts’ikumbe usoo. (Hebu uso wa munzio.) Ichikala ni seti ukumbe, oga mikonoyo na sabuni chividzo kwanza.
eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

dug: Ukati wa kutosha wa kwimba, “Ts’iku ya raha ya kuvyalwa” k’ano mbiri
eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
wash the back of your hands

dug: Uchikala udzikumba, uts’ijali. We chidzako oga mikonoyo na sabuni.
eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

dug: Chisha, uts’ikumbe konze ya masiki ichikala vindaidimikika.
eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

dug: Vidudu vinakula ndani ya masikiyo uchikala undazivala muno.
eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

dug: Tsupha vitambaa vya kufunga p’ula na mulomo/masiki uchisikira zitsoka. Uts’izivale zaidi ya ts’iku mwenga!
eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

dug: Uts’irye leu phamwenga na at’u, hebu mukats’anganya viya, vikombe hebu t’aulo.
eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

dug: Kw’idima kukumba usoo na chikokorito hata ukakala wajeza.
eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

dug: Fugula na kufunga muyango na chikokorito hebu mafuzi kurichisa mikono pharipho yinaidimikika.
eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
and after being out in the public

dug: Chila ukati oga mikonoyo na sabuni…
eng: Always wash your hands with soap…

dug: Soma vitabumajarida kwa utumia unji Zaidi!
eng: Read the articles for more tips!
